question_text:
Question 29  
[Complier Design (Syntax Directed Translation)]
Which of the following statements is/are FALSE?
(A) An attribute grammar is a syntax-directed definition (SDD) in which the functions in the semantic
rules have no side effects
(B) The attributes in a L-attributed definition cannot always be evaluated in a depth- first order
(C) Synthesized attributes can be evaluated by a bottom-up parser as the input is parsed

PAGE
20

(D) All L-attributed definitions based on LR(1) grammar can be evaluated using a bottom-up parsing
strategy
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
(B) There is no fixed procedure of evaluating
 L
 – attribute in depth – First order
(D) There is a fixed procedure which all 
L
-attributed which al
 L
-attributed definitional based on LR (1)
using bottom-up parsing.
Hence, the correct option is (B) and (D).
